channel.title: Help with getting a new video card
channel.description:
So, I think my GeForce 8600 GTS has finally seen it's days, and am now considering getting a better board. The question is, what card should I get?
I'm looking for something $200 or less.
Also hoping to run Crysis (and finish it, finally), so I'd appreciate an nVidia GeForce.

item.title: Help with getting a new video card
item.dc:creator: Guf
item.description:
Some of us still reckon old school = 8bit…

Read full topic
item.source: Help with getting a new video card

item.title: Help with getting a new video card
item.dc:creator: Mango_Assassin
item.description:
NavMan:

He can consider himself lucky. I was running a Geforce2 Ti 64MB until late 2007.

Talk about old school… :retard:

Read full topic

item.title: Help with getting a new video card
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
Well, like I’ve said, my computer is ancient.

I plan on getting a job, saving up $3000-$4000, and buying myself a computer that’s gonna last at least 5 or so years.

item.title: Help with getting a new video card
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
And I thought my old Radeon 9000 was bad. Back in the days I had it with 256 MB RAM and a 1.1 GHz Athlon. I then upgraded it to 512 MB of RAM to play HL2.

item.title: Help with getting a new video card

item.description:
I win out on you all, bitches!

GeForce 5200 FX

Suck it.

item.source: Help with getting a new video card

item.title: Help with getting a new video card
item.dc:creator: Fungus
item.description:
Using an eVGA 9600GT (might be super/overclocked… cant remember) and even with the rest of my sub-par system the only thing it cant run maxed out seems to be… drumroll Crysis. go figure. its a helluva little card. only takes up 1 slot too. they go for $100-$120 last I checked.

NavMan:

I remember how I used to envy those who could play it with shiny reflective water and shadows!

first actual vid card I got was in the 6’s, or lower. was freaking amazed when I booted up HL2 and saw wood splinters and blood splats everywhere. :awesome:

Read full topic
item.source: Help with getting a new video card

item.title: Help with getting a new video card
item.dc:creator: NavMan
item.description:
sersoft:

The geforce2 GTS however, was able to play hl2 totally fine coupled with a dual pentium III board and 1gb of ram…

If by totally fine you mean at the lowest DX7 settings then yes, it ran flawlessly. I remember how I used to envy those who could play it with shiny reflective water and shadows!

Read full topic
item.source: Help with getting a new video card

item.title: Help with getting a new video card
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
I’m sure he was joking, an MX wouldn’t have much of a chance even in regular HL2, let alone EP2.

The geforce2 GTS however, was able to play hl2 totally fine coupled with a dual pentium III board and 1gb of ram…

Read full topic
item.source: Help with getting a new video card

item.title: Help with getting a new video card
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
How’d you get it to start? I have a 32 meg radeon 7500 in the laptop and OB games give me a shader error before they start…

Read full topic
item.source: Help with getting a new video card

item.title: Help with getting a new video card
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Mith:

Haha man, I had a Geforce2 MX/MXsomething with 64mb until early 2008, that shit was awesome, finished HL2:Ep2 in that crap, constant 15fps ftw.

Geforce 2 GTS was the shit back in the day, 3 times faster than a geforce 4 mx.

Also I’ve had the worst PC’s all the way until december 2008 when I moved to the Core 2 Duo.

I had to upgrade from socket 478 to socket 775, from AGP to PCI-E, from DDR to DDR2, from 20pin ATX to 24pin ATX and from IDE to SATA (all at once)

Read full topic

item.source: Help with getting a new video card

item.title: Help with getting a new video card
item.dc:creator: Collision
item.description:
God bless XFX.

Redoing the thermal paste on all my XFX mobo coolers keeps the temps much lower, since I have an NForce board, and the NB can get a wee bit hot.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with getting a new video card

item.title: Help with getting a new video card
item.dc:creator: MaxTheLimit
item.description:
Level:

You’d think a one lifetime warranty would be enough.

Double lifetime means that you can modify the card by adding a cooler. You can pump over stock voltage, modify the bios, and it will still be under warranty.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with getting a new video card

item.title: Help with getting a new video card
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
wtf how did this post get on this thread?

if someone sees this that can delete this post please do that

Read full topic
item.source: Help with getting a new video card

item.title: Help with getting a new video card
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
MaxTheLimit:

I just bought THIS and for you it’s under 200. XFX means you get the double lifetime warranty ( you fuck it up they still replace it ). Plays Crysis rather well.

If you insist on team green then THIS is the only GTX 275 I could find for under 200 bucks and that is after MIR. I wouldn’t drop to a GTX 260, just to be nvidia as the benefits at that point are about null.

You’d think a one lifetime warranty would be enough.

Read full topic
